issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I created a security group with description "képzések" in Firefox. Console threw an internal error.

Note this affects the create security group operation on the following pages...
- Create security group page (i.e. not in wizards)
- Create security group in launch instance wizard
- Create security group in launch config wizard
fields.summary: Non-latin characters in security group description trigger internal server error

comments.body: [~kgill], We've got letters numbers and spaces covered, and have specified which special characters in other validation error messages, I believe. Can you check those and copy what they've got? That will work for now, we can figure out something to do across the board for scannability later.

[~jloza]: We don't have the special characters covered on other validation messages, since prior to VPC we allowed ASCII chars without slashes.  When VPC was implemented in 4.1, we didn't update our validation rules to handle the additional constraints.

Perhaps we should leave the wording as-is, since a user is unlikely to type more than one special character.  For example, if a user enters "Joe's security group", the validation notice makes it obvious that the single-quote character is the culprit.
[~kgill] are you sure? I feel like I have seen them, somewhere. Perhaps in the IAM screens? CC: [~dkavanagh]

So, there's this: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/eucaconsole/templates/panels/user_editor.pt#L29
I wouldn't call that pretty by any means. I wonder if we can specify the larger list of characters in a hover if the user mouses over the error message?
That message is not ideal, but will work for now. Better to be specific and fugly than vague and concise.
[~alice] please be sure all supported characters are now explicitly called out in the validation error message when QAing this ticket. Thanks!
hi [~kgill], sorry for the confusion! Yes, we should be explicit about what is allowed, listing all valid characters. Nobody likes guessing (unless it's a surprise party or something)!

[~jloza] Understood.  I still think it's pretty obvious what characters are invalid without listing them all since a user is unlikely to enter more than one special character, and the validation feedback kicks in fairly quickly when that invalid character is entered.  But I'll defer to the "it's better to be explicit..." approach here and will list the valid special characters.  BTW, how should those characters be displayed?  Should we smash them together as I've done in the earlier comment, or should we surround each character with parentheses, separated by commas?  Please advise with an example here.
